availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Walker Jr. (Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer. Married Rachel W. Walker c1850. Father of Mary E. Walker, John R. Walker, Parodine A. Walker, Adaline F. Walker, Margaret C. Walker, Milbern W. Walker, William T. Walker. Farmer in Edmonson County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Edmonson County, Kentucky in 1860. Enrolled for military duty in Second District of Kentucky on July 1, 1863 (U.S.A).

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 68. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 48. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Edmonson County, KY, May 1865, p. 642, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
